descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: This course is designed to enhance students' knowledge of urban schooling, especially as related to dynamics of race, class, and culture. It provides an analysis of policies and practices and how they have/are implemented to meet the "need" of the individuals and groups who interact with these institutions. We will explore the following: historical and political economic factors influencing urban education; the distribution of opportunity and wealth in cities and schools; multicultural education, the development of positive school cultures, and the use of community services and resources. The goal is to encourage and foster students' critical thinking and reflective practice to address the pressing challenges which students face in American urban public schools.
